ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more grammar structures, vocabulary, and Kanji. I also had improvement in my speech as well.
I learned more kanji of course, but I was also exposed to more cultural things about Japan.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought the set up of the course was really good. By having discussion based class, it really emphasizes and improves our talking and understanding skills.
I liked how we looked at different kinds of media and readings. I liked how I learned not just Japanese, but things about and in Japan too.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is great for students trying to further their knowledge in Japanese.
If you like Japanese, then I highly recommend taking it up all the way to L5. It is a pretty fun class and its very good at improving your language skills in every facet.
